page.title: 06The R.C.National Shrine
page.content: {1829}Act of Catholic Emancipation. Shrine of Our Lady of Walsingham established at King's Lynn. {1897}Purchase of 13th century Slipper Chapel.First Post_Reformation pilgrimages. {1934}Transfer of Shrine to Slipper Chapel.Declared National Shrine of Our Lady by Bishops of England and Wales.Annual National Pilgrimage begins. {1948}Pilgrimage of Crosses:continued every year at Student Cross (Ecumenical). {1954}Crowning of the Statue of Our Lady in the name of Pope Pius XII. {1980}Building of Chapel of Reconciliation to hold 700 with Open_Air Sanctuary (consecrated 1982). {1985}Addition to Pilgrim Bureau of Handicapped Centre_Accommodation 120.
